questions.question: 1. Time dependent permanent deformation is called ____.

explanations.a: Plastic deformation is the permanent distortion that occurs when a material is subjected to tensile, compressive, bending, or torsion stresses that exceed its yield strength and cause it to elongate, compress, buckle, bend, or twist.
explanations.b: Elastic deformation is a change of the shape of the body as a reaction to applied stress.
Creep occurs at all temperatures. This deformation occurs at constant stress. It is a time-dependent phenomenon.
